greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n - phi(2*n), where phi() is the Euler totient A000010().
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 840.
T. M. Apostol, Introduction to Analytic Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, 1976, page 24.
example: If n = (2^m)*p, with m = 3 and p = 7, then n = 2^3 * 7 = 56, and a(56) = 2^3 = 8.
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Apr 08 2010
ext: Offset corrected; entry corrected and edited by _Michel Lagneau_, Apr 25 2010
